content: beaded placemat materials bernat handicrafter cotton or other worsted weight cotton yarn 160 yds of off-white per placemat crochet hook size k 18 wooden beads one-half inch diameter per placemat yarn needle gauge 5 double_crochet = 1 5 inches 3 double_crochet row = 1 5 inches finished mat size 11 5 x 18 inches abbreviations chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet space = space yo = yarn over bead double_crochet = work first half of double_crochet slide bead up on hook complete double_crochet instructions you may string beads on yarn before beginning mat or you may fasten yarn at end of row 16 string beads onto yarn and attach yarn again note chain-3 counts as first double_crochet chain 49 row 1 double_crochet in fourth chain from hook and in each chain across chain 3 turn 47 dcs row 2 - 4 double_crochet in each st across chain 3 turn row 5 2 double_crochet *skip next st work 3 double_crochet in next st skip next st double_crochet in next st repeat from * across ending last repeat with double_crochet in last 2 sts chain 3 turn 11 three-double_crochet shells row 6-8 double_crochet in each st across chain 3 turn row 9 repeat row 5 row 10-12 double_crochet in each st across chain 3 turn row 13 repeat row 5 row 14-16 double_crochet in each st across chain 3 turn do not turn at end of row 16 begin to work in rounds beading round chain 3 bead double_crochet in same space *3 double_crochet evenly spaced along end of work bead double_crochet in next st repeat from * along end of mat until 9 beads have been placed work 3 double_crochet in same st as last bead double_crochet double_crochet in each st across placemat ending with 3 double_crochet bead double_crochet in last st repeat entire sequence from * ending with 2 double_crochet in the first st of this round join with slip_stitch to top of chain-3 round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in same space single_crochet in each st around mat working 2 single_crochet in each corner st join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet fasten yarn and weave in ends © 2007 beverly button http //www buttonspecialties com please do not reproduce sell or distribute this pattern by any means you may sell your finished work made from this pattern
